Detailed Description

Wave file data access.

Definition at line 61 of file WaveFile.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Aquila::WaveFile::WaveFile ( unsigned int  frameLengthMs = 0,
double  frameOverlap = 0.66 
) [explicit]

Creates the WaveFile object.

By default, no frame division will be performed after loading data from file. If frameLengthMs is given and is not 0, all calls to load() will perform frame division. Adjacent frames can overlap each other, the default overlap length is 66% of frame length.

Parameters:
frameLengthMs frame length in milliseconds (0 - dont use frames)
frameOverlap overlap between adjacent frames

Definition at line 38 of file WaveFile.cpp.

Aquila::WaveFile::~WaveFile (  ) 

Deletes the WaveFile object.

If there was any frame division, deletes all frames.

Definition at line 97 of file WaveFile.h.

int* Aquila::WaveFile::getData (  )  [inline]

Returns a pointer to data table.

Because vector guarantees to be contiguous in memory, we can return the address of the first element in the vector. It is valid only before next operation which modifies the vector, but as we use it only to copy that memory to another buffer, we can do that safely.

Returns:
address of the first element

Definition at line 198 of file WaveFile.h.

unsigned int Aquila::WaveFile::getWaveSize (  )  const [inline]

Returns the recording size (without header).

The return value is a raw byte count. To know the real sample count, it must be divided by bytes per sample.

Returns:
byte count

Definition at line 135 of file WaveFile.h.

void Aquila::WaveFile::load ( const std::string &  file  ) 

Reads the header and channel data from given .wav file.

Data are read into a temporary buffer and then converted to channel sample vectors. If source is a mono recording, samples are written to left channel.

To improve performance, no format checking is performed.

Parameters:
file full path to .wav file
